article.title: Top 20 Things To Do In Koh Samui, Thailand
article.lead_paragraph:
Lying in the Gulf of Thailand off Kra Isthmus’ east coast is Thailand’s second largest island, Koh Samui. Known for its idyllic beaches lined with coconut groves, the island is one of the favourite destinations for beach goers in Thailand. However, even if you are not one for the beach, there are numerous ways to enjoy the beautiful island too. Read this article for the top 20 things you can do in Koh Samui suitable for all occasions!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXRFypTaJkA
article.meta_description: Koh Samui is a hot holiday destination for travellers looking for a perfect beach getaway in Thailand. However it’s not just a haven for beach lovers. Here’re the top 20 things to do in Koh Samui!

But do you know that other than pristine beaches, fine sand and sea, there are other splendid sights you should not miss on Samui? Read on to discover the 6 distinct sights you must visit on this lovely island.

snippets.title: 1. Big Buddha Temple (Wat Phra Yai)
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BBrQPFHSASM

As you arrive by air at the Koh Samui Airport, there is a majestic icon you will not miss - the Big Buddha Temple, known locally as the Wat Phra Yai. Located near the airport, the 12-metre (40-foot) gold-painted Buddha statue sits atop a hill off the northeastern coast of Koh Samui. Seek inner peace as you visit the temple and marvel at the impressive Buddha in a state of calm and purity.

> #### Big Buddha Temple (Wat Phra Yai)
>
> **Address**: Highway 4171, Hat Bang Rak 84140, Thailand
>
> **Price**: free.
>
> **Opening Hours**:  always open.

snippets.title: 2. Guan Yu Shrine
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BRLjE-djuYO

In Chinese Buddhism, Guan Yu, a Chinese general from ancient times, is revered as a bodhisattva. While it is easy to find numerous shrines paying homage to him in places where the Chinese live, Koh Samui’s Guan Yu Shrine is a sight to behold. Standing several metres taller than Big Buddha, the bronze statue with a big red head, in dark green and gold armour, backed by a long-handled sword piercing the sky, certainly portrays a mighty image. Get to know more about the colourful history of Samui’s Chinese through the intriguing displays and ceremonies here.

To visit Guan Yu Shrine, get to Hua Thanon village and it is located off the inland side of the village’s ring road. Look for a red gate on the right if you miss the looming red head while approaching from the north.

> #### Guan Yu Shrine
>
> **Address**: 190/1 Moo 1, Tambon Maret, Koh Samui, Surat Thani 84310
>
> **Price**: free.
>
> **Opening Hours**:  8 am - 5 pm daily.
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 418 854
>
> **Website**: [Guan Yu Shrine (in Thai only)](http://www.saljaohuathanon.com)

snippets.title: 3. Ang Thong National Marine Park
snippets.description:
Ang Thong National Marine Park is the dream destination of any island hopper, popularised by the Alex Garland’s famous novel ‘The Beach’. As an archipelago of 42 islands 28 kilometres (17.4 miles) from Koh Samui, its towering limestone mountains, dense jungle, lakes and waterfalls make it a picture-perfect spot to explore. The vast national marine park is home to exotic wildlife, both on land and sea. Whether you are game for some hiking, snorkelling or diving, there is surely something to excite you in the tropical paradise!

> #### Ang Thong National Marine Park
>
> **Address**: 346/1 Amphoe Mueang Surat Thani, Chang Wat Surat Thani 84000, Thailand
>
> **Price**: 300 THB (8.70 USD) per adult foreigner, 150 THB (4.35 USD) per foreign child under 12 years old or 120 cm in height, 40 THB (1.20 USD) per local.
>
> **Access**: book a government-approved tour boat on Koh Samui to reach Ang Thong
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 420 225

snippets.title: 4. Hin Ta & Hin Yai
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BTRUXHrFQ9F

Hin Ta and Hin Yai, also known as Grandfather and Grandmother Rocks respectively, are thought-provoking rock formations located on Koh Samui’s south coast. With an unusual appearance like the male and female genitalia, it is not surprising Hin Ta and Hin Yai often brings about embarrassed giggles from visitors. Don’t just feel tickled by the unique works of Mother Nature when you visit. Read about the tragic legend through the signboard near the rocks for a local interpretation of how the rocks were formed. Of course, you can also look out for the spectacular views from the rocks and vicinity.

> #### Hin Ta & Hin Yai
>
> **Address**: 92 84310 126/92 Moo 3 Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand
>
> **Price**: free.
>
> **Access**: off Route 4169 on Samui’s south-east coast, about two kilometres south of central Lamai Beach

snippets.title: 6. Secret Buddha Garden
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BSnu6RvhApA

Perched high up on the hills of central Koh Samui is the private Secret Buddha Garden, offering a unique collection of Buddha statues nestled in a lush jungle next to the waterfall and stream. All the sculptures are individually hand carved with exquisite stone decorations, depicting tales from popular Buddhist folklore and mythology. Gain insights to their intrinsic meanings through the tour guide.

> #### Secret Buddha Garden
>
> **Address**: 22/1 Moo 4 Ban Bangrak, Ko Samui 84320, Thailand
>
> **Price**: 80 THB (2.30 USD) per person.
>
> **Access**: In Baan Saket, get on the air force road leading up to Ta Nim Waterfall. The road turns into a dirt track for the last 400 metres of the ascent. There are many signs along the way. Only experienced drivers should attempt the road, best done in a 4WD vehicle. Or visit the gardens as part of an adventure day trip such as a jungle/safari tour or ATV ride.
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 245 255

snippets.title: 7. Ride a quad bike
snippets.description:
The pristine island dies not only boast mind-blowing coastal landscapes. Head inland, and you will discover the beauty of its dense jungle with stunning hidden waterfall and panoramic viewpoints. Riding a quad bike, which is a motorcycle with four large tyres for off-road use, is an exciting way to venture through the natural landscapes and see a different Koh Samui. It will certainly make an unforgettable adventure for everyone!

> #### X-Quad Samui
>
> **Address**: Maenam Soi 5 Atv , Koh Samui 84320, Thailand
>
> **Price**: from 4,900 THB (142.40 USD) for a 4-hour tour.
>
> **Contact**: +66 90 980 5401 (Nic); +66 86 341 5301 (ปลา)
>
> **Website**: [X-Quad Samui](http://www.xquad-samui.com/)

snippets.title: 8. Kayaking
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BTLkRadA_NM/

One of the best ways to enjoy Ang Thong National Marine Park fully is via kayaking. With over 40 islands on the popular archipelago, paddle your way through the concealed lagoons and hidden caves to discover its breathtaking beauty. Marvel in awe as you get up close to a vast array of rich marine life and scenic landscapes. Who knows, you may even be the lucky one spotting families of dolphins or turtles swimming alongside your sea kayak!

> #### Viator Tour - Sea Kayaking at Ang Thong National Marine Park from Koh Samui
>
> **Address**: Koh Samui, Thailand
>
> **Price**: from 3,085 THB (89.65 USD) for a full-day 9-hour tour.
>
> **Contact**: +1(702) 648-5873
>
> **Website**: [Sea Kayaking at Ang Thong National Marine Park](https://www.viator.com/tours/Koh-Samui/Sea-Kayaking-at-Ang-Thong-National-Marine-Park-from-Koh-Samui/d347-3685SMU25?pref=02)

snippets.title: 9. Chill by the beach
snippets.description:
There are times when we just feel like relishing some quiet moments and relax. Lamai Beach will make the perfect spot with its laid-back atmosphere. Unlike Chaweng, the largest resort area in Koh Samui, Lamai Beach is quieter and less touristy. Nonetheless, it is home to many accommodation, dining, shopping and spa options. So enjoy the idyllic chill out without being too far out from modern conveniences on Lamai Beach.

> #### Lamai Beach
>
> **Address**: southeastern coast of Koh Samui, Thailand

snippets.title: 11. Gun shooting
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/_oLTIlI1M3

Take a break from the usual beach and nature tours on Koh Samui. Make your way to the island’s main shooting range near the Chaweng beach area for an entertaining day ahead. Fully qualified instructors will be on-site to train you with the fundamentals before you enjoy the firing at paper cut-outs with real bullets. Throughout the shooting session, you will be under strict supervision from your instructor too. So have fun with gun shooting!

> #### Samui Paragon Gun Shooting Range
>
> **Address**: Amphoe Koh Sa-Mui, Surat Thani, Thailand
>
> **Price**: from 890 THB (25.90 USD) for a 10-bullet session with .22 rifle.
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 424 000
>
> **Website**: [Samui Paragon Gun Shooting Range](https://www.facebook.com/SamuiParagonGun/)

snippets.title: 12. Thai cooking class
snippets.description:
Thai cuisine is loved by many, for its exotic blend of flavours and fragrances. If you love Thai food, why not learn how to cook a typical 3-course Thai lunch from professional chefs on Koh Samui? Visit the local market to find fresh ingredients and learn to prepare the dishes thereafter. Besides learning how to cook these delicious dishes on your own, you will also be able to experience the local way of life through the market tour.

> #### Viator Tour - Half-Day Thai Cooking Classes in Koh Samui
>

>
> **Price**: from 1,840 THB (53.49 USD) for a 4-hour tour.
>
> **Contact**: +1(702) 648-5873

snippets.title: 14. Fruit carving class
snippets.description:
Originally used only to decorate tables of the Thai royal family, Thai fruit carving is a highly-regarded traditional Thai art requiring superb precision and skill. Make your Koh Samui trip meaningful by learning the basics of this respected art through an interesting fruit carving class. Learn how to carve ornate flower patterns using Thai fruits, vegetables and garnishes with hands-on session conducted by professional instructors. Enhance your dishes with a delicate fruit carving to impress your loved ones back home after the class.

> #### Samui Institute of Thai Culinary Arts
>
> **Address**: 46/6 Moo 3, Chaweng Beach, Borphut, Koh Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand
>
> **Price**: from 2,500 THB (53.49 USD) for a 1-day class.
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 413 172
>
> **Website**: [Samui Institute of Thai Culinary Arts](http://sitca.com/thai-fruit-and-vegetable-carving/)

snippets.description:
Thai massages are world famous, known as a wonderful form of relaxation for the body. In the tropical island paradise, what better way to relax and recharge than to indulge in a spa treatment? There is a myriad of sophisticated spas to take your pick from in Koh Samui. If you are looking for the best in Chaweng, indulge in a full suite of wide-ranging spa treatments at Magnolia Spa. The professional masseurs will make even the reluctant spa goer a truly satisfied customer!

> #### Magnolia Spa
>
> **Address**: 21/22 Moo 2, North Chaweng, Koh Samui, Suratthani 84320, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  11 am till late. Last session at 7.30 pm.
>
> **Price**: from 950 THB (27.60 USD) for a 90-minute traditional Thai massage.
>
> **Contact**: +66 77 601 133/4
>

snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BQ5iVVYFJsE

Elephant Walk Koh Samui is a small night market located just a short walk from the Happy Elephant Restaurant in Fisherman’s Village. Despite the short stretch of only 30 metres (98.4 feet), the night market offers a quirky shopping experience where you can find a diverse mix of small local boutiques. Check out the cute comic elephant statues lined along the gravelled central courtyard as well.

> #### Elephant Walk Koh Samui
>
> **Address**: Bophut Beach Road, Bophut, Koh Samui, Suratthani 84320, Thailand
>
> **Access**: Opposite Happy Elephant Restaurant in Fisherman’s Village

snippets.title: 17. Chaweng Night Market
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BTCLtkTjhbS

Unlike Elephant Walk Koh Samui, Chaweng Night Market is more of a food market where you can tuck into a wide array of food. With just a couple of stalls selling clothes and souvenirs, Chaweng Night Market is effectively a large food court offering quality dishes at affordable prices as low as 50 THB (1.45 USD) for snacks and 70 THB (2 USD) for local dishes. Come here to enjoy a sumptuous dinner under the stars and experience the vibrant night scene.

> #### Chaweng Night Market
>
> **Address**: 14/102 Moo 2, behind Star Gym, Chaweng Beach Road, Chaweng, Koh Samui, Suratthani 84320, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  5 pm - 11 pm daily.

snippets.title: 18. Fisherman’s Village
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BMl54zkgUjA 

The Fisherman’s Village is a popular spot for locals and tourists, particularly on Friday evenings when the Walking Street Market is closed to traffic. Chomp down on delectable street food from grilled squids to kebabs. Of course, expect to see the usual souvenir stalls selling quintessential Thai knick-knacks, including plenty of souvenirs made from coconuts.

> #### Fisherman’s Village
>
> **Address**: Bophut Beach Road, Bophut, Koh Samui, Suratthani 84320, Thailand
>
> **Opening Hours**:  5 pm - 11 pm daily.

snippets.title: 19. Sunset bars by the beach
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BgGCK27lfGw/?tagged=airbarsamui

Who thinks surreal beaches can only be enjoyed during the day? You probably have not been to a sunset bar by the beach in Samui then. Discover hidden gems at lesser known beaches on the island’s west coast with an awesome beachfront dining experience. Watch the gorgeous sunset while you sip a glass of cocktail under coconut trees. For a stylish sundowner dining experience, Air Bar at Intercontinental Samui Resort and Woobar at W Retreat Koh Samui will assure you a memorable end to an unforgettable evening in the Gulf of Thailand.

Enjoy!

lead_paragraph_embed.value: Lying in the Gulf of Thailand off Kra Isthmus’ east coast is Thailand’s second largest island, Koh Samui. Known for its idyllic beaches lined with coconut groves, the island is one of the favourite destinations for beach goers in Thailand. However, even if you are not one for the beach, there are numerous ways to enjoy the beautiful island too. Read this article for the top 20 things you can do in Koh Samui suitable for all occasions!

navigator.introduction: Rachel has forgotten when and exactly how she caught the travel bug. What she does remember is the triumphant feeling she enjoys when she sees the fascinating world out there with her own eyes. She lives by the motto "you don't have to be rich to travel well", and hunting down value-for-money deals gives her a great sense of accomplishment. While she hasn't been everywhere, she endeavours to go some place she has never been before at least once a year. To date, unforgettable travel destinations include Niagara Falls, Switzerland and Tasmania, and she would like to go anywhere with mind-blowing natural scenery, UNESCO Heritage Sites, wildlife and great food! Follow her navigation experiences around the world on "The GPS Gal's Penchant for Travelling".
